author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: India has clarified its stance on the Dalai Lama's succession, stating it doesn't take a position on religious matters, despite a minister's personal support for the Dalai Lama's wishes. This comes as China cautioned India against interfering in Tibetan affairs, a comment later omitted from their official briefing transcript.
title: Govt doesn't take stand on matters of faith, says MEA on Dalai succession issue

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump signed the "big, beautiful bill" into law, extending the 2017 tax cuts and increasing funding for border security. The legislation, passed with narrow margins in both the House and Senate, also includes major reductions in Medicaid spending and changes to SNAP benefits. It raises the debt ceiling and increases the state and local tax deduction temporarily.
title: Trump's July 4 fireworks: 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' signed - Here's what it means

author: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN
description: The CUET-UG 2025 results saw two women among the top three, with Ananya Jain leading. Despite high scores, candidates are questioning syllabus deviations, errors, and the normalisation process. While registrations increased slightly, the number of test-takers declined, and fewer universities participated amid concerns about the exam's framework. Frustration persists over discrepancies, especially in the physical education paper.
title: 2 girls among top 3 in CUET-UG, Delhi boy bags second position

author: TNN
description: During Operation Sindoor, India faced a complex challenge with Pakistan, actively supported by China and Turkiye, according to a top Army officer. China provided Pakistan with real-time satellite intelligence on Indian military movements. Pakistan used Chinese weaponry, while Turkiye supplied drones. The conflict highlighted the need for improved C4ISR, air defense, and civil-military fusion.
title: Army deputy chief: Op Sindoor faced 3 foes - Pakistan, China & Turkiye

author: SIDHARTHA
description: India will only agree to a trade deal with the US if it safeguards national interests and provides a sustainable tariff advantage, according to Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal. Prioritizing farmers' interests, India aims for duty concessions in labor-intensive sectors like leather and textiles.
title: National interest, not deadline, to dictate US trade deal: Piyush Goyal

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: US President Donald Trump signed the "One, Big, Beautiful Bill" into law during a Fourth of July celebration. The legislation includes tax cuts, increased military and immigration enforcement spending, and Medicaid reductions. The Department of Homeland Security lauded the bill's $165 billion appropriation, emphasizing its support for border security and deportation efforts.
title: 'Promises made, promises kept': Donald Trump signs 'One Big, Beautiful Bill' into law

author: ANUJA JAISWAL
description: The Indira Gandhi National Centre for the Arts (IGNCA) is embarking on a Rs 45 crore project to conserve Gandhian heritage sites in Wardha, Maharashtra. Collaborating with MGIRI, the 18-month initiative aims to restore Gandhi Smriti Bhavan, Kasturba Kitchen, and Wardha Haat.
title: To restore key Gandhian sites, IGNCA unveils Rs 45 crore project

author: TNN
description: Following the IAF's lead, the Navy is preparing its first woman fighter pilot. Sub-Lieutenant Aastha Poonia received her "Wings of Gold" after completing transitional fighter training on Hawk advanced jet trainers. She will now undergo extensive training on MiG-29K fighters, potentially becoming the first woman to operate from an aircraft carrier, marking a significant milestone for women in naval aviation.
title: After IAF, Navy gets 1st woman fighter pilot

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: The Boston Celtics have signed Jalen Bridges, a former teammate of Kevin Durant, to potentially fill the void left by Jayson Tatum's Achilles injury. Tatum is expected to miss most of the 2025-26 season. Bridges, a 6-foot-8 forward, played sparingly for the Phoenix Suns. Despite modest professional stats, his college career showcased a strong perimeter shooting ability.
title: Boston Celtics add 6'8 ft ex-Suns big man to boost title push, support Tatum

author: TNN
description: The ED has seized Rs 34 crore worth of properties linked to Kannada actress Ranya Rao and associates in a gold smuggling and money laundering case. This follows searches at premises connected to Karnataka home minister G Parameshwara, after Rao claimed association with him.
title: ED seizes 34 crore assets of Ranya & aides in gold smuggling case

author: TNN
description: Abhishek Manu Singhvi, representing Sonia Gandhi, argued in a Delhi court that the ED's National Herald case is a peculiar money-laundering case lacking property movement or gains for Congress leaders. He questioned the 11-year delay between AJL's restructuring and ED's action, asserting that no property shifted from Associated Journals Ltd to Young Indian Pvt Ltd.
title: Herald case against Sonia Gandhi 'truly strange': Abhishek Singhvi in court

author: DURGESH NANDAN JHA
description: Addressing the Indian diaspora in Port of Spain, PM Modi highlighted the shared roots in Bihar, particularly referencing PM Kamla Persad-Bissessar as "Bihar ki beti." He acknowledged the hardships faced by indentured laborers and praised their enduring faith, especially their devotion to Lord Ram.
title: Lord Ram, Bihar common thread as PM Modi addresses diaspora in Port of Spain

author: PRABIN KALITA
description: Manipur is set to close approximately 350 relief camps housing those displaced by the ethnic violence that began in May 2023. The state government plans a three-phase rehabilitation program, starting this month, offering financial aid. Around 7,000-8,000 people whose houses were destroyed will receive Rs 3 lakh each to rebuild.
title: Manipur to close relief camps, launch three-phase rehab plan

author: MANASH PRATIM GOHAIN
description: The Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) convened a three-day meeting in Delhi to discuss the potential role of its members in emergencies, including war-like scenarios and civil defense exercises. Discussions also addressed concerns regarding alleged atrocities against Hindus in Bangladesh and Bengal. The meeting involved reviewing organizational progress and planning for the centenary celebrations.
title: RSS discusses role in crises, war-like drills

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: As the Toronto Maple Leafs continue to reshape their roster post-Mitch Marner trade, new reports suggest Nazem Kadri could be eyeing a return. A recent development claims Kadri may waive his no-move clause for Toronto. With Calgary Flames unwilling to sell low, this potential blockbuster deal might be the next big twist in the Leafs' offseason.
title: Toronto Maple Leafs eye shock reunion as Kadri trade rumor with Calgary Flames gains traction

author: AKASHDEEP VIRK
description: Panjab University is implementing a strict anti-drug policy, requiring students to sign an undertaking to abstain from drugs, alcohol, and tobacco. Students must consent to random drug testing and face disciplinary action for violations. This initiative follows a University Grants Commission advisory and aims to create a safe, drug-free campus environment, prompted by a recent drug overdose incident.
title: Yes to dope tests, no to drugs: Panjab University pupils must sign pledge

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: Experts at an IIT-Delhi conference emphasized the necessity of involving urban and transport planners in highway projects within urban areas. Virendra Kumar Paul highlighted concerns about highway engineers' ability to assess detailed project reports (DPRs). SPA and IIT-Delhi proposed pilot projects to evaluate DPRs and suggested establishing a Centre of Excellence for crash investigation.
title: Experts flag DPR gaps: Call for urban planners in highway projects; IIT, SPA offer NHAI help

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Several prominent footballers, including Adam Johnson, Benjamin Mendy, and Cristiano Ronaldo, have faced serious sexual assault allegations. Johnson was jailed for sexually touching a minor, while Mendy was acquitted of rape charges and now plays for FC Zurich. Ronaldo was accused of sexual assault, but the case was dismissed, and his accuser's lawyer was fined for bad faith.
title: Three footballers accused of sexual assault in the past: Adam Johnson, Mendy, & Ronaldo

author: NASEER GANAI AND SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha inaugurated the Shri Amarnath Shrine Board’s Yatri Niwas Complex in Baltal, reporting that over 20,000 devotees have already completed the pilgrimage. The third group of 6,411 pilgrims departed from Jammu for the Himalayan shrine as the Yatra proceeds smoothly along both Pahalgam and Baltal routes under tight security.
title: Amarnath Yatra 2025: 20k visit holy cave; 3rd pilgrim batch leaves Jammu

author: MANOJ CHAURASIA
description: Congress's initiative to distribute sanitary pads with Rahul Gandhi's image in Bihar sparked controversy, drawing criticism from NDA leaders who deemed it an insult to women. The scheme, aimed at promoting menstrual hygiene, faced backlash as opponents questioned the appropriateness of featuring a male figure on sanitary products.
title: Free sanitary pad packs with Rahul Gandhi's pic stir Bihar poll row

author: SANJAY KHAJURIA
description: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district have been engaged in a joint anti-terror operation for three days in the Kuchal-Chatroo forested area. The operation, initiated based on intelligence inputs, aims to locate two to three Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists believed to be trapped. Additional resources have been deployed to assist in the ongoing search amid challenging weather and terrain.
title: J&K: Kishtwar op enters Day 3; JeM terrorists believed trapped

author: NASEER GANAI
description: Hurriyat Conference chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq has urged making J&K a dry state like Gujarat, opposing the opening of more liquor shops. He argues it contradicts Islamic values and fuels addiction, especially among youth. Despite rising alcohol sales linked to increased tourism post-Article 370 abrogation, Mirwaiz insists J&K thrived as a tourist destination for centuries without promoting liquor.
title: Make J&K dry like Gujarat: Hurriyat leader Mirwaiz

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Mohammed Siraj's six-wicket haul and Akash Deep's four wickets helped India bowl out England for 407, securing a 180-run first-innings lead. Harry Brook and Jamie Smith's strong partnership was broken by the Indian bowlers. At stumps, India were 64 for 1, extending their lead to 244, with Akash Deep crediting Gautam Gambhir and Morne Morkel for boosting his confidence.
title: Akash Deep opens up on Gambhir's pep talks before Edgbaston Test

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: Canada hikes fund requirement for foreign students: Indians must show Rs 14 lakh

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: India endured a punishing day at Edgbaston as Harry Brook (158) and Jamie Smith (184) stitched a mammoth 303-run stand, rescuing England from 25/3 to a defendable 407. Despite six ducks, India’s somewhat erratic bowling allowed the hosts back in. Mohammed Siraj’s fiery six-wicket haul, including a late burst, gave India a 180-run lead and a sliver of hope.
title: Edgbaston’s wild ride: Six ducks, two centurions, and one fiery fifer

author: AMBIKA PANDIT
description: The government has introduced Unified Waqf Management Empowerment Efficiency and Development Rules 2025, mandating the upload of waqf property details onto the Central Waqf Portal within six months. Mutawallis must provide comprehensive information, with penalties for delays. State governments are required to publish and upload lists of 'auqaf' within 90 days.
title: Govt notifies waqf rules to step up property registration and monitoring through central portal

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: A BJP feud surfaces in flood-hit Himachal Pradesh as MP Kangana Ranaut claims Jairam Thakur advised her to delay visiting Mandi due to connectivity issues, contradicting his earlier criticism of her absence. Chief Minister Sukhu seized on the apparent discord between the two leaders. The state government announced relief measures for affected families, including rental assistance and food supplies.
title: Kangana Ranaut vs Jairam Thakur on Mandi floods?: BJP MP clarifies on her absence

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Luka Doncic, the Los Angeles Lakers star, boasts an impressive car collection of 13 vehicles, showcasing his passion second only to basketball. His garages in Slovenia and the U.S. reveal a fondness for red cars, including a Ferrari 812 Superfast. Among his prized possessions are vintage classics like a 1968 Chevrolet Camaro and a 1967 Ford Bronco.
title: Luka Doncic’s car collection: Brabus Rocket, $363K Ferrari 812 & more

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 911 call, then robbery: Indian-origin men arrested in Georgia for bizarre thefts

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: An Air India pilot fell ill before a Bengaluru-Delhi flight, causing a delay as another pilot took over. The pilot is now stable and under observation. This incident follows a recent fatal crash in Ahmedabad and other operational challenges for the airline, including flight cancellations and a stall warning on a Delhi-Vienna flight.
title: Air India pilot suffers medical emergency before take-off, collapses

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: During the second Test at Edgbaston, Jasprit Bumrah was spotted in the Indian dugout wearing a radio earwig, drawing attention from commentator Ravi Shastri. India, after scoring 587, watched as England's Harry Brook and Jamie Smith formed a strong partnership. Mohammed Siraj's impressive 6/70 helped India bowl England out for 407, securing a significant first-innings lead.
title: Bumrah bursts into laughter at Ravi Shastri's on-air comment

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Tensions flared on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test when Yashasvi Jaiswal was given out LBW, prompting a late review. England captain Ben Stokes contested the timing of the DRS call, leading to a heated discussion with the umpires and KL Rahul. Despite the drama and crowd's reaction, the review confirmed Jaiswal's dismissal.
title: Controversy! Yashasvi takes late DRS call; Stokes clashes with umpire

author: RAUNAK BOSE
description: Damian Lillard, recently waived by the Milwaukee Bucks, has garnered interest from several NBA teams, including the Boston Celtics. Despite recovering from an Achilles injury and being unlikely to play in the upcoming season, Lillard is evaluating his options. The Celtics face hurdles in clearing salary cap space and managing roster logistics to potentially sign the nine-time All-Star.
title: Damian Lillard linked to Celtics: Sudden Bucks exit sparks buzz, what’s next ?

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi's foreign policy, alleging strained relations with neighboring countries like Nepal, alongside China and Pakistan. Speaking in Hyderabad, Kharge accused Modi of neglecting domestic issues, citing his numerous foreign visits while Manipur faces unrest. He challenged the BJP's stance on secularism and socialism, questioning their presence in the party's constitution.
title: ‘Modi ji, where are you?’: Kharge slams PM, says 'India surrounded by enemies'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Air India Express faced DGCA scrutiny for allegedly falsifying compliance documents related to Airbus A320 engine maintenance, following a European Union Aviation Safety Agency directive. The airline reportedly missed deadlines for replacing critical engine components, prompting internal disciplinary actions.
title: Months before AI 171 crash, DGCA warned Air India Express of delays in engine fixes

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Sonia Gandhi criticized the Enforcement Directorate's money laundering case related to the National Herald as "truly a strange case." Her lawyer, Abhishek Manu Singhvi, argued the case lacked substance, highlighting the absence of property involved. The ED alleges Sonia and Rahul Gandhi laundered money through a fraudulent takeover of Associated Journals Ltd's assets.
title: National Herald case: 'Strange, unprecedented,' Sonia Gandhi tells court, cites 'Hamlet'

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Narendra Modi visited Trinidad and Tobago. He addressed the Parliament and spoke about the strong ties between India and Trinidad. He received the country's highest civilian honor. President Christine Kangaloo praised Modi's kindness. Modi also highlighted the shared love for cricket. His visit is part of a five-nation tour. He will also attend the BRICS Summit in Brazil.
title: ‘We cheer for West Indies except when ... ’: PM Modi’s cricket banter in Trinidad

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: On the surface, it sounds like an act of calculated advantage-seeking. After all, Columbia, like most elite universities then, ran race-conscious admissions. Identifying as Black might have increased his chances in a system designed to redress centuries of racial exclusion. Critics, including Mayor Eric Adams, quickly pounced, calling it “an insult to every student who got into college the right way.”
title: Why Indian-origin Mamdani identified as African-American in his college application

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump's new economic package faces criticism. Experts like Ray Dalio warn of potential financial disruptions. The bill increases national debt significantly. Concerns arise about rising interest rates and a weaker dollar. Some fear the US may lack resources for future crises. The package's impact on the global economy is also under scrutiny. Markets are watching closely for potential interventions.
title: $425K debt/family: How Trump’s bill could gut US - Wall Street waves red flag

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the Order of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago, the nation's highest civilian honor, during his official visit. Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar recognized PM Modi's global leadership, ties with the Indian diaspora, and Covid-19 humanitarian work. PM Modi dedicated the award to 1.4 billion Indians.
title: Caribbean visit: PM Modi receives Trinidad and Tobago's highest civilian honour

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: The world of showbiz is buzzing with legal twists, emotional revelations, and resurfaced memories. From Saif Ali Khan’s ancestral Bhopal properties being declared 'Enemy Property' and his plea getting rejected by the High Court, to Baazigar actress Resham Tipnis expressing outrage over fake news about her son Manav's suicide — drama and disbelief are running high. Add to that Smita Jaykar’s candid recall of real-life sparks between Salman Khan and Aishwarya Rai during Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam, and you’ve got a roundup of the top 5 entertainment stories stirring conversation in tinsel town today.
title: From Saif Ali Khan to Resham Tipnis: Top 5 entertainment news

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Content creator Priyam Saraswat's video tour of a gold-laden mansion in Indore, owned by government contractor Anoop Agarwal, sparked outrage. The video, showcasing gold-coated interiors and luxury cars, led to accusations of misappropriated public funds.
title: House of gold: Indore contractor’s 24-carat gold-plated villa draws fire

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: WWE's female superstars have amassed considerable wealth through lucrative contracts, merchandise sales, and endorsements. Becky Lynch leads with a net worth of $7 million, followed by Charlotte Flair at $5 million. Liv Morgan's net worth is around $3 million, while Rhea Ripley's is estimated between $1 million and $3 million, boosted by various brand collaborations.
title: Richest WWE women stars: Rhea Ripley to Becky Lynch; net worth revealed

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: A new US bill, championed by President Donald Trump, is raising concerns about its impact on America's renewable energy sector. Experts warn it favors older industries while hindering the growth of solar, wind, and electric vehicle markets. Critics, including Elon Musk, foresee a loss of competitiveness against China, which is aggressively investing in clean energy.
title: Trump’s 'big, beautiful bill': Why it's making China laugh - and stronger

author: NIRMALYA DUTTA
description: It sounds like Swami Vivekananda Diego over dharma, but those who read that line and stop there prove precisely why he said it in the first place.It is as misunderstood as Karl Marx’s “religion is the opium of the masses,” which, as Kurt Vonnegut pointed out, for its time and place was like saying religion is like aspirin. It just gave people a little peace in troubled times.
title: Why Swami Vivekanda batted for football

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: An insider view into Connor McDavid’s current mindset paints a complex picture as the Edmonton Oilers superstar weighs his future. While no official contract talks have started, NHL analysis suggests that the ongoing silence could lead to mounting pressure if the Oilers fail to align with McDavid’s long-term goals.
title: Connor McDavid’s mindset: What is it according to insiders' view on Oilers contract

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pune police report a twist in the alleged rape case involving an IT professional, indicating the assailant was known to the woman. Evidence suggests the selfie used was taken and edited by her, and she typed the threatening message. Authorities are investigating the rape claim, noting inconsistencies in her initial account and her mental state.
title: Twist in Pune rape case: Woman knew accused from before, wrote 'threat note' herself

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: VVS Laxman orchestrated a valuable experience for India's U19 cricketers, arranging their visit to the Edgbaston Test to witness Shubman Gill's impressive innings. Coach Hrishikesh Kanitkar emphasized the importance of learning red-ball cricket techniques from Gill's masterful approach. Young players like Vaibhav Suryavanshi and Anmoljeet Singh expressed inspiration, fueling their aspirations to represent India after watching Gill's performance.
title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi watches Edgbaston Test, reveals his role model

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Zach Werenski and Odette Peters enjoyed a pre-wedding trip. The couple visited eight countries and ten cities. They explored Ireland, Egypt, Turkey, and Greece. They also went to Germany and Switzerland. The couple shared photos of their adventures online. They rode camels near the Pyramids of Giza. Friends joined them for parts of the trip.
title: Zach Werenski, Odette Peters tour: Dreamy pre-wedding journey, endless romance

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Hailee Steinfeld and Josh Allen made their first public appearance as a married couple, showcasing Steinfeld's dazzling diamond-encrusted wedding band. The couple, who tied the knot in a private ceremony at San Ysidro Ranch on May 31, celebrated with an intimate family dinner, a lively welcome party, and an "underground afterparty" that lasted until 3 a.m.
title: Hailee Steinfeld finally flaunts dazzling diamond wedding ring post marriage with Josh Allen

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: '1 border, 3 adversaries': Pakistan was live lab for China to test weapons

author: NIRMALYA DUTTA
description: If blues was the magic carried by African slaves, chutney music was the sorcery of Indo-Caribbeans. It is Bhojpuri folk electrified with Caribbean swagger – dholak beats fused with soca basslines and steelpan melodies. Lyrics toggle between Hindi, English, and Creole, telling stories of Krishna’s rasleela, rum-shop heartbreak, and gossip at weddings.
title: Bhojpuri beats and Bihar ki Beti: India’s deep cultural connection with the Caribbean

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal stated that any trade agreement between India and the United States will only occur if it benefits both nations. India does not adhere to deadlines for trade agreements.
title: India-US trade deal: 'We don't make deals based on deadlines,' says Piyush Goyal

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India has refrained from commenting on the selection process for the next Dalai Lama, emphasising its commitment to religious freedom. This stance follows the current Dalai Lama's declaration that his successor will be chosen by the Gaden Phodrang Trust, a statement perceived as a challenge to China's claim to appoint the next spiritual leader.
title: ‘No position on matters of faith’: India reacts to Dalai Lama succession row

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India initially dominated Day 3 of the second Test, dismissing key England batsmen early. However, Jamie Smith and Harry Brook launched a stunning counterattack, scoring centuries and shifting the momentum. Their aggressive batting dismantled India's bowling strategy, particularly punishing Prasidh Krishna, whose expensive spell highlighted concerns about India's pace attack.
title: Worst in 148 years! Prasidh Krishna sets unwanted Test record

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: During the second Test against England, Indian captain Shubman Gill was struck on the head while fielding, causing immediate concern. Fortunately, after treatment, he resumed playing. This incident followed Gill's emotional high after receiving messages from his parents, celebrating his record-breaking double century, marking a significant milestone in his career and India's Test history in England.
title: Scary scene! Shubman Gill takes nasty blow to the head

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Vanessa Bryant, continuing the family's Dodgers fandom, attended a game with her daughters Natalia, Bianka, and Capri. The family cheered on their favorite team as Clayton Kershaw achieved his 3,000th strikeout, a significant milestone. Vanessa shared photos and videos of the special night on Instagram, highlighting the family's love for baseball and celebrating Kershaw's achievement.
title: Vanessa Bryant steps out: Special mother-daughter night, honors Dodgers’ Clayton Kershaw

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: In Kerala's Malappuram district, Muhammadali, 52, confessed to a killing he committed as a 14-year-old in 1986. He claims he acted in self-defense after being harassed while working on Devassya's property in Kozhikode. Burdened by guilt following recent family tragedies, Muhammadali led police to the scene.
title: 38 years of guilt: Kerala man, in his 50s, confesses to killing unknown man in 1986

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: First woman fighter pilot in Navy: Sub Lt Aastha Poonia receives ‘Wings of Gold’

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: 'I'm coming home, baby!': Diddy's courtroom victory cry

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: A video shows Joe Burrow walking alone in Beverly Hills. This has led to fan concern. The Bengals quarterback appeared downcast. Social media is full of reactions and theories. Some fans worry about his well-being. Others speculate about the reason for his mood. There is no official statement from Burrow or the Bengals. The internet continues to discuss the video.
title: Joe Burrow trends online: Fans spot him alone, 'extremely sad' in Beverly Hills

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis has vowed zero tolerance for hooliganism in the name of Marathi pride, following recent assaults on individuals for not speaking the language. This statement comes after incidents like the Mira Road assault, where a shop owner was attacked.
title: Marathi slapgate row: Fadnavis says 'hooliganism will not be tolerated'

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India has proposed retaliatory tariffs against the United States at the WTO in response to American safeguard measures on the automobile sector. The US imposed a 25% tariff increase on imports of passenger vehicles, light trucks, and specific automobile parts from India.
title: 'Reserve right to ...': Amidst trade talks, India eyes retaliatory duties against US

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Former Miami Dolphins safety Reshad Jones, known for his on-field prowess, is now a victim of a $2.6 million embezzlement scheme. Financial advisor Isaiah Williams allegedly siphoned funds for personal luxuries, with Octavia Monique Graham accused of laundering over $1 million. Graham is in custody, while Williams remains at large, leaving Jones grappling with betrayal and significant financial loss.
title: Reshad Jones loses $2.6M: Alleged con by trusted advisor; luxury spending spree

author: SOUMITTRA S BOSE
description: A tragic accident on the Samruddhi Expressway near Washim claimed the lives of four members of the Jaiswal family from Umred. The incident occurred when their car collided with a divider, resulting in the deaths of Radheshyam Jaiswal, Madhuri Jaiswal, Vaidehi Jaiswal, and Sangeeta Jaiswal. The driver is critically injured and under treatment.
title: Samruddhi Expressway crash: Nagpur businessman Radheshyam Jaiswal among 4 dead

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Elon Musk wants the International Space Station to shut down. He suggests focusing on Mars missions instead. He thinks the ISS is old and costly. NASA plans to deorbit the ISS by 2030. Some support Musk's Mars vision. Others worry about losing ISS research and partnerships. A gradual shift is a suggested solution. The debate continues.
title: Elon Musk wants the ISS retired: Slams Trump’s $1.25 billion funding

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ishan Kishan last played a Test for India during the tour of the West Indies in July 2023. While his IPL 2025 season with Sunrisers Hyderabad was modest — 354 runs in 14 games — his recent red-ball form in England has been far more compelling. On Wednesday, in an unexpected turn, he was handed the ball and made full use of the opportunity.
title: '6 balls, 6 actions': Ishan Kishan imitates Dhoni, Harbhajan, Warne in 1 over

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pune police detained a man accused of raping a 22-year-old IT professional in Kondhwa. The suspect posed as a courier executive. He allegedly raped her after gaining entry to her flat. He also clicked a selfie with her unconscious. The man threatened to release her photos if she reported the crime. Police are investigating the case and reviewing CCTV footage.
title: 'Delivery agent' who assaulted Pune techie in flat arrested after 2 days

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell on Day 3 of the Edgbaston Test has put India in a commanding position. He dismissed Joe Root and then Ben Stokes for a golden duck in consecutive deliveries. Root edged a flick to Pant, while Stokes was undone by a sharp bouncer. India aims to level the series after England's initial victory.
title: DSP Siraj breathes fire! Sends Stokes for a duck, leaves Root fuming - WATCH

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Central Tibetan Administration (CTA) president, Penpa Tsering, challenged China's claim over the Dalai Lama's succession, questioning Beijing's interference in Tibetan religious freedom. This response follows China's insistence on the 'Golden Urn' process, which Tsering argues is a relatively recent imposition.
title: Dalai Lama successor: Tibet's prez-in-exile picks apart China's 'Golden Urn' tradition

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pappu Yadav, a Congress-leaning MP, has declared a "do-or-die battle" against the Election Commission's electoral roll revision in Bihar, labeling the ECI as an "office of the RSS." Congress has also criticized the revision as a "sinister exercise" to disenfranchise voters. Despite opposition protests, parties like RJD, Congress, and others have deployed thousands of BLAs for the revision process.
title: 'Is ECI God?': Pappu Yadav's 'do-or-die' call as Bihar roll revision row flares

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Allahabad High Court has dismissed a plea by the Shahi Jama Masjid committee, challenging a survey of the Shahi Idgah mosque in Sambhal. Hindus claim the mosque was built over a demolished temple.
title: Krishna Janmabhoomi row: Allahabad HC says Shahi Eidgah ‘not disputed’; plea dismissed

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A massive explosion at a Rome fuel station injured 20, including eight police officers responding to the scene. Initial reports suggest a truck crashed into a pipeline, triggering the blast and subsequent fires. The incident, marked by a large fireball and thick smoke, prompted evacuations of nearby buildings, including a children's camp.
title: Watch: Massive fireball erupts in Rome fuel depot; over 20 injured

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Slt Aastha Poonia made history as the first woman to be trained as a fighter pilot in the Indian Navy. She and Lt Atul Kumar Dhull were awarded the 'Wings of Gold' at @IN_Dega. This achievement marks a significant step towards gender inclusivity in Naval Aviation, promoting equality and opportunity within the Indian Navy.
title: Aastha Poonia becomes 1st woman to be trained as fighter pilot

author: H M CHAITHANYA SWAMY
description: In Bengaluru's Vivek Nagar, Subramani allegedly set fire to his relative Sathish Kumar's house over a financial dispute. The incident, occurring on July 1st, caused damage to the property, though no injuries were reported. The conflict stemmed from a loan taken years ago by Parvati from Venkataramani.
title: Caught on cam: Man sets relative's house on fire over financial dispute

author: SANJAY SHARMA
description: The CUET UG 2025 result has been officially declared by the National Testing Agency. Over 13 lakh candidates can now check their scorecards on cuet.nta.nic.in or through the direct result link. The scores will be used for admissions across 243 universities, including DU, BHU, JNU, and AMU. This year’s results are based on normalised percentiles, and include postponed papers such as Tamil, Urdu, and accountancy. Counselling and admission processes will begin shortly.
title: CUET UG 2025 scorecards released at examinationservices.nic.in, check direct link here

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Michael Vaughan believes Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal, and Rishabh Pant must collectively fill the void left by Virat Kohli's departure from Test cricket. Vaughan acknowledged their potential but emphasised the need to replicate Kohli's intensity and global dominance to maintain India's competitive edge. He cautioned against underestimating the impact of losing Kohli and Rohit Sharma.
title: 'Drag India forward like Kohli': Vaughan's challenge to Gill, Jaiswal, Pant

author: RASHMI DROLIA
description: A shocking video surfaced from Pashupatipur Primary School in Wadrafnagar, showing headmaster Laxmi Narayan Singh intoxicated and dancing inappropriately with girl students. This misconduct, along with allegations of frequent inebriation and unwarranted physical punishment, prompted swift action. Balrampur District Education Officer D N Mishra suspended Singh, and local MLA Shakuntala Porte demanded strict disciplinary measures.
title: Drunk teacher dances with schoolgirls in classroom; suspended after viral video

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: When rookie Will Cuylle faced living in a hotel, Vincent Trocheck, remembering his own challenging start, offered him a home with his family in Harrison, New York. Cuylle quickly became part of the Trocheck family, celebrated by Vincent's wife, Hillary, who proudly calls him her son. Recently, Cuylle signed a two-year, $7.
title: ‘Proud mom moment’: Hillary Trocheck reacts as Will Cuylle renews contract with NHL team

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Vijay, the Tamil film star, has been announced as the chief ministerial candidate for his party, Tamizhaga Vetri Kazhagam (TVK), in the 2026 Tamil Nadu assembly elections. TVK, launched in February 2024, aims to bring fundamental political change. Vijay plans a state-wide tour from September to December to strengthen the party's base.
title: Tamil Nadu 2026 polls: TVK names actor Vijay CM candidate; can he take on MK Stalin?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Trent Ltd.'s shares plummeted 8.7% after its AGM revealed a projected revenue growth slowdown to 20% for Q1FY26, significantly lower than the previous 35% CAGR. Nuvama brokerage downgraded the stock to 'hold,' reducing the target price due to concerns about moderating growth and high valuations.
title: Trent share price today: Stock drops around 9%; Nuvama downgrades

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Russian boxer Anastasia Luchkina is under fire after a video surfaced showing her giving an e-cigarette to Dana, an orangutan at a Crimean safari park. The endangered orangutan has since exhibited disturbing behavior, including loss of appetite and lethargy. Veterinarians are examining Dana, fearing she may have ingested the nicotine cartridge, while the incident has sparked widespread outrage and condemnation.
title: Watch: Russian boxer gives e-cigarette to orangutan; video sparks outrage

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: The Bharat Mobility Global Expo is gearing up for its 2027 edition. The event will take place in Delhi NCR. It is scheduled from February 4 to 9. The expo will showcase automotive, logistics, and technology advancements. New segments will include multimodal, urban, and rural mobility. Tractors and agricultural solutions will also be highlighted.
title: Bharat Mobility Expo’s next edition announced: And it’s not next year! Details

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Lieutenant General Rahul R Singh revealed that China provided Pakistan with real-time intelligence during India's 'Operation Sindoor.' He highlighted that Pakistan may target Indian population centers in future conflicts, emphasizing the need for a robust air defense system.
title: Big revelation on Op Sindoor: 'China fed Pak live data on India assets, Turkey sent trained staff'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sophia Hutchins, Caitlyn Jenner's manager and a prominent transgender activist, tragically died in an ATV accident near Jenner's Malibu home at the age of 29. Hutchins, known for her work with the Caitlyn Jenner Foundation and appearances on 'I Am Cait,' was remembered for her dedication to transgender advocacy and her impact on the community.
title: Caitlyn Jenner manager Sophia Hutchins, 29, dies in Malibu ATV crash

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Grandmaster Vidit Gujrathi defended his family members' professions after a social media user questioned their legitimacy as doctors on National Doctors' Day. The dispute arose when Gujrathi acknowledged his father, an ayurvedic specialist, mother, a cosmetologist, sister, a physiotherapist, and wife, a homeopathic doctor.
title: Chess | 'No time for noise': Vidit Gujrathi hits out at 'LiverDoc' for insulting doctor parents, family

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Shefali Jariwala, famed for 'Kaanta Laga', passed away at 42 due to cardiac arrest. Directors Radhika Rao and Vinay Sapru paid tribute. They confirmed 'Kaanta Laga' would never have a sequel. The directors shared memories of discovering Shefali. Her last rites were performed. The industry mourned the loss of the iconic 'Kaanta Laga' girl. Her contribution will always be remembered.
title: ‘It was always yours’: Kaanta Laga makers speak up after Shefali Jariwala’s death

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India's SEBI has accused Jane Street of market manipulation, alleging the firm artificially inflated stock prices to benefit from options trading, generating substantial profits. The regulator has frozen Rs 4,844 crore and imposed a market ban on the global trading giant. Jane Street has the option to appeal the decision.
title: Jane Street ban: Why has SEBI barred US-based trading firm? Explained

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Prada faces online criticism for sandals resembling Indian Kolhapuri chappals without acknowledging the artisans. Edelweiss MF CEO Radhika Gupta emphasized the importance of crediting original creators and preserving India's textile heritage. Following backlash, Prada will meet with MACCIA on July 11 to discuss potential collaboration, including co-branded collections and skill development, aiming to recognize and benefit Kolhapuri artisans.
title: 'Till lion learns to write...': Radhika Gupta slams Prada amid sandals row; what she said

author: APEKSHA TANWAR
description: AP ECET 2025 counselling registration has begun from July 4 at cets.apsche.ap.gov.in. Eligible candidates who scored at least 25% in the exam can register online, pay the fee, and upload documents. The process includes choice filling and seat allotment. Required documents include academic certificates, ID proof, and category documents. Final allotments depend on merit, preferences, and seat availability.
title: AP ECET counselling 2025 kicks off today; registration now live at cets.apsche.ap.gov.in

author: TNN
description: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Lajpat Nagar, Mukesh Paswan, a garment worker, murdered his employer's wife and teenage son. The gruesome crime occurred after a dispute over a Rs 45,000 advance and Paswan's absenteeism. He was arrested in UP while attempting to flee.
title: Delhi double murder: Boy walked into scene of mother's murder, tried to hide in bathroom

author: KAUSHIK KANNAN
description: In Dindigul, Balakrishnan, a former BJP member, was murdered. The incident occurred near Madur Junction. A gang attacked him with billhooks. Balakrishnan died at the scene. Police suspect a monetary dispute as the motive. Sanarpatti police are investigating the case. They are searching for the suspects involved in the crime. The event happened on Thursday evening.
title: Ex-BJP functionary hacked to death in TN; manhunt launched

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Torrential rains and cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh have claimed at least 69 lives and caused over Rs 400 crore in damages since June 20. Mandi district is the worst-hit, with homes collapsing and vehicles being swept away. Rescue operations are underway as the IMD forecasts continued heavy rainfall and potential landslides.
title: Himachal rain crisis: 69 dead, many missing; rescue ops on

author: ARANI BASU
description: Shubman Gill is proving his mettle as India's new Test captain, silencing doubts with a remarkable performance in England. His dedication and hunger for runs were evident in his extensive training sessions. Gill's leadership extends beyond his own batting, as he actively supports the young batting group, fostering a confident and positive mindset within the team.
title: IND vs ENG: Insatiable Shubman Gill shows why he's undisputed leader of lineup

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: Following the assault of a shopkeeper in Mira Road for not speaking Marathi, Maharashtra minister Nitesh Rane urged, "show courage, go to Null Bazaar, Mohammed Ali Road and tell people there to speak Marathi." The incident occurred after an argument over language, with the shopkeeper claiming he was slapped for stating that many languages are spoken in Maharashtra.
title: Language row: Maha minister asks why 'Javed, Aamir' spared for not speaking Marathi

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump met with Saudi Arabia's defense minister to discuss de-escalation with Iran and broader Middle East peace efforts, including ending the Gaza conflict and hostage release negotiations. The administration aims to expand the Abraham Accords, with potential new countries joining soon. These discussions occur amid heightened tensions following recent military operations and ongoing efforts to restart nuclear talks.
title: US-Iran deal on cards? Trump meets Saudi def min, Tehran in focus

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravindra Jadeja dismissed Ben Stokes' pitch tampering accusations as mind games after a heated exchange during the second Test at Edgbaston. The incident arose after Chris Woakes complained about Jadeja allegedly damaging the pitch's danger area. Jadeja, who scored a crucial 89 in India's dominant 587, defended his actions, stating his focus was on batting, not altering the pitch.
title: 2nd Test: Jadeja hits back at Stokes - 'Why would I do that? My focus was on batting'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
title: ‘Big Beautiful’ speech: This Democrat spoke for over 8 hrs; GOP passed bill right after

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena (UBT) leader, criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the deteriorating road conditions in Varanasi, his parliamentary constituency. Raut highlighted viral social media images of collapsed roads and difficulties faced by pilgrims.
title: Sanjay Raut takes 'vikas purush' jibe at PM Modi over Varanasi roads

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: The brother of murdered Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi suspects Raja’s wife, Sonam, the prime suspect, may have secretly married her accomplice while in hiding after the honeymoon murder in Meghalaya. He criticized Sonam’s brother for expressing a desire to meet her after initially seeking forgiveness from the deceased's family.
title: Secret wedding? New twist in honeymoon case; cops find second ‘mangalsutra’

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Donald Trump announces a UFC fight at the White House for America's 250th birthday. The event anticipates nearly 25,000 spectators. Dana White will organize the championship fight. Trump highlights the scale of the celebration with professional and amateur events. The White House confirms the plans. The UFC and Trump have a long-standing relationship.
title: Trump eyes White House lawn as UFC battleground; plan for America’s 250th anniversary

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 propelled India to a commanding position in the second Test against England at Edgbaston. The 25-year-old captain surpassed records previously held by Indian legends like Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar. In the video, Gill emphasised on the importance of staying at the crease and playing grounded shots, showcasing his dedication to representing India.
title: IND vs ENG 2nd Test: Shubman Gill's old video surfaces on day he scored 269 runs - watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's record-breaking 269 against England at Edgbaston was followed by an emotional moment as he received a congratulatory message from his parents. The BCCI captured Gill's post-match routine, including recovery, media duties, and a warm welcome at the hotel. Gill acknowledged the importance of his father's guidance in his cricketing journey, while also humorously lamenting missing his triple century.
title: IND vs ENG: 'I missed my 300' - Shubman Gill gets emotional after parents' message

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has barred Jane Street, a US trading firm, from participating in the Indian securities market following an investigation into suspected manipulation through equity derivatives positions. SEBI also plans to recover 48.4 billion rupees from Jane Street, claiming the firm obtained the funds through improper practices.
title: Jane Street ban: US trading firm barred by SEBI from accessing India's securities market

author: etimes.in
description: A new promo for 'Laughter Chefs Season 2' teases drama and excitement, featuring Krushna Abhishek and Elvish Yadav. Krushna humorously seeks a remedy from a Pandit for Elvish's 'Supreme Court matter,' with the Pandit suggesting spousal support is key.
title: Mahhi Vij breaks silence on divorce rumours with husband Jay Bhanushali

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Soham Parekh, an Indian software engineer, admitted to simultaneously working at multiple Silicon Valley startups due to financial struggles, after being exposed on social media. Despite the controversy sparked by a Mixpanel co-founder's allegations, Parekh secured a founding engineer position at an AI video startup. He claims desperation, not malice, drove his actions.
title: Soham Parekh: Indian techie confesses to multi-job scam: No one likes to work 140 hours, but...

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Friday. While Nifty50 was above 25,400, BSE Sensex was up over 50 points.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex near 83,300

author: TNN
description: The postmortem report of Sivaganga custodial death victim Ajith Kumar revealed multiple injuries. The report confirmed custodial torture. There were signs of internal bleeding in the brain, heart, and abdomen. Forensic experts noted abrasions and contusions all over Ajith Kumar's body. The autopsy was performed late. Further examination is pending to determine the exact cause of death.
title: TN custodial death: Postmortem confirms torture; internal bleeding in brain

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump is considering hosting a UFC match on the White House grounds as part of the America 250 celebrations. The president announced this plan during a speech at the Iowa State Fairgrounds, mentioning his friendship with UFC CEO Dana White.
title: UFC fight at White House? How Trump wants to mark America's 250th I-Day

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ravindra Jadeja's crucial 89 and his significant partnership with Shubman Gill highlighted India's recovery on Day 2 against England. Jadeja, however, raised eyebrows by breaking BCCI protocols for extra practice, justifying it as vital preparation. He also refuted Ben Stokes' accusation of pitch tampering. With England struggling at 77 for 3, Jadeja hinted at further dominance from India.
title: 2nd Test: 'In Eng, you never feel set' - How Jadeja broke BCCI rule to get more practice

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Trinidad and Tobago, marking the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister since 1999. He addressed the Indian community, acknowledging their contributions and strong ties to India. Modi referred to Prime Minister Kamla Persad-Bissessar as "Bihar ki Beti," highlighting her ancestral roots and the cultural connection between the two nations.
title: 'Bihar ki beti': PM Modi hails Indian roots of Trinidad & Tobago PM

author: TNN
description: Arun Kumar was arrested for allegedly assaulting a coffee shop employee in Sheshadripuram after an argument over an extra cup. The incident escalated when Haque, the cashier, refused to provide an additional empty cup, leading to a verbal exchange and physical altercation. CCTV footage captured Arun and his friends assaulting Haque, who retaliated with a sharp object.
title: B'luru cafe brawl: Staff attacked after denying extra cup; watch

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Vladimir Putin paused a major event to take a call from Donald Trump, fearing offense at being kept waiting. The leaders engaged in a lengthy discussion covering topics such as Ukraine and Iran, though Trump expressed disappointment at the lack of progress on a Ukraine peace deal.
title: 'Could get offended': Putin rushes out mid-event to take Trump's call - watch

author: VEENA MANI AND SHILPA PHADNIS
description: The IT industry is seeing a significant increase in moonlighting-related background checks due to low salary increases and job market uncertainty. Verification firms are flagging more cases of overlapping employment, particularly in the IT services sector, as remote work makes it easier for professionals to take on additional roles.
title: Low salary hikes: Moonlighting on rise; IT firms tighten checks

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In a significant move, Russia has officially recognized the Taliban's leadership in Afghanistan, becoming the first nation to do so since their 2021 takeover. This decision follows Moscow's removal of the Taliban from its list of banned organizations. The Russian foreign ministry has received credentials from the new Afghan Ambassador, signaling enhanced bilateral cooperation.
title: Russia first to officially recognise Afghanistan's Taliban govt

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook for the Nifty and Bank Nifty, anticipating potential gains. They recommend buying UPL between Rs 670-690, targeting Rs 747, and Chennai Petroleum Corporation in the range of Rs 700-720, with a target of Rs 787.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for July 4 - check list

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Vitamin D is crucial for bone health, immune function, and mood, yet deficiency is widespread due to limited sun exposure and poor diet. Sunlight is the most effective way to boost vitamin D levels, especially during midday when UVB rays are strongest.
title: Which is the most effective way to boost Vitamin D levels immediately

author: TNN
description: The Gujarat High Court has taken action against Bhaskar Tanna. He is a senior advocate. The court issued a contempt notice. This followed a viral video. It showed Tanna using a phone and drinking from a beer mug during a hearing. Judges expressed concern. They said his behavior damaged the court's dignity. Further hearings are scheduled.
title: Virtual Court Shocker in Gujarat: Lawyer sips beer, speaks on phone mid-hearing

author: TOI
title: B'desh radical group vows to model country on Taliban-run Afghanistan

author: TNN
description: In Kondhwa, Pune, a 22-year-old data scientist was allegedly raped in her apartment by a man posing as a courier delivery agent. The assailant sprayed a chemical on her face, took a selfie with her, and threatened to upload it if she reported the crime.
title: Blackmail, fake parcel: How 'delivery agent' drugged, raped Pune techie in her flat

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Travis Kelce's candid discussion about his reading challenges during his Saturday Night Live hosting gig has ignited widespread speculation and conversation. Despite struggling with table reads, Kelce's dedication shone through, earning praise for his performance. His openness has sparked discussions about learning difficulties, drawing both support and criticism, while highlighting the courage in embracing vulnerability.
title: ‘I can’t really read that well’: Travis Kelce’s SNL admission sparks dyslexia debate

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: India staged a remarkable recovery in the second Test against England, amassing 587 runs after being 211/5. Shubman Gill led the charge with a magnificent 269, his maiden Test double century, supported by Yashasvi Jaiswal and Ravindra Jadeja. Akash Deep's two quick wickets then left England struggling at 77/3, trailing by a massive 510 runs.
title: IND v ENG: Historic fightback! Shubman Gill's 269 powers India's greatest recovery

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sourav Ganguly lauded Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 against England, calling it an "absolute masterclass" and suggesting No.4 is his ideal Test position. Gill's record-breaking double century propelled India to a massive total, putting them in a commanding position to level the series after losing the opener. Ganguly believes this Test is India's to win.
title: IND v ENG: 'Opening was not his place' - Ganguly lauds Gill's majestic knock

author: PREMENDRA MISHRA
description: In a shocking case mirroring the Meghalaya honeymoon murder, a newlywed in Aurangabad, Bihar, allegedly orchestrated her husband's murder with her uncle, just 45 days after their wedding. Gunja Singh, 30, and her accomplice, Jeevan Singh, 52, were arrested after investigations revealed their involvement in the contract killing of Priyanshu Kumar Singh, 32, driven by a long-standing illicit affair.
title: 'Inspired by Sonam': How newlywed plotted husband’s murder

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Brittany Mahomes is fostering camaraderie among NFL WAGs, exemplified by her thoughtful gift to Emily Mayfield. This gesture, along with her advocacy for food allergy awareness through her OWYN partnership, highlights the supportive relationships transcending team rivalries. Paige Loren also expressed her admiration for Brittany's OWYN collaboration, showcasing the growing bond among these women.
title: NFL WAGs bond over protein shakes: Brittany Mahomes surprises Baker Mayfield’s wife

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump admitted that his conversation with Putin yielded no progress on a ceasefire in Ukraine, despite advocating for a swift end to hostilities. Putin, however, affirmed Russia's commitment to achieving its objectives and addressing the conflict's root causes, while expressing openness to diplomatic solutions.
title: 'No progress with Putin': Trump on Russia-Ukraine ceasefire after 'pretty long call'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rumours floated about Tom Brady and Sydney Sweeney after they were seen dancing. Sources say Sweeney is not seeking a relationship post her breakup with Jonathan Davino. Neither Brady nor Sweeney has commented on the rumours. Brady's dating life is under scrutiny since his divorce from Gisele Bundchen. Reports suggest Brady's behaviour is deterring potential partners.
title: Tom Brady–Sydney Sweeney buzz dims: Actress ‘not interested’ in relationship

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: House Republicans passed the 'ONE BIG BEAUTIFUL BILL,' securing President Trump's signature on July 4. The legislation makes permanent $4.5 trillion in tax cuts, introduces new tax breaks, and enacts $1.2 trillion in spending cuts targeting Medicaid and food stamps. It also allocates $350 billion for border security and raises the national debt ceiling by $5 trillion.
title: 'Biggest bill ever': Trump hails US Congress for passing ' One Big, Beautiful Bill'

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: The Fourth of July commemorates the Declaration of Independence in 1776, marking America's separation from British rule and the birth of a nation founded on liberty and self-governance. Celebrated with gatherings and fireworks, it symbolizes courage, unity, and hope.
title: Happy US Independence Day: Celebrate freedom with heartfelt wishes and messages

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Shubman Gill's magnificent 269 propelled India to a commanding 587, leaving England trailing by 510 runs at stumps on Day 2. Gill's record-breaking innings surpassed numerous milestones, including the highest score by an Indian captain in Tests, exceeding Kohli's previous best. His knock also stands as the highest by an Indian batter in England and outside Asia, solidifying his place in cricket history.
title: IND vs ENG: In a league of his own - Shubman Gill rewrites Test record books

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza’s ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ continues its successful run, earning Rs 2.75 crore on its 14th day, bringing the total to Rs 135.56 crore. Despite a slight dip in occupancy, the film maintains a steady pace, captivating audiences with its heartwarming story and stellar performances. The film now faces competition from the newly released ‘Metro In Dino.’
title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par' day 14: Aamir Khan starrer maintains a steady pace; mints over Rs 135 cr

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Angel Reese, the WNBA star, reveals her love for 'Love Island' in a viral tweet, proving even athletes enjoy reality TV. Amidst her demanding basketball career with the Chicago Sky and recent Reebok collaboration, Reese connects with fans through relatable content. Her growing influence extends beyond sports, solidifying her status as a pop culture figure.
title: Love Island fever grips WNBA too: Angel Reese declares obsession with reality show

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Caitlin Clark's highly anticipated signature shoe with Nike is generating significant buzz, with projections estimating it could become a $150 million business. Following her Nike contract and the success of her special edition Kobe V Protro, which sold out rapidly, anticipation is building for the official launch expected in 2026.
title: Caitlin Clark’s first signature sneaker could be worth nine figures; projects up to $150M valuation

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Tiffany Salmond, a prominent New Zealand footy presenter, alleges she was pushed out of NRL broadcasts due to being perceived as "too bold" by TV executives. Salmond claims major networks made a collective decision to sideline her, leading to a lack of work opportunities. She advocates for rethinking the treatment of outspoken female reporters in the media industry.
title: NRL reporter pushed out: Tiffany Salmond says networks sidelined her
